lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The lower costs that should now be possible -- especially after the rationalisation of the loss making minerals division -- should allow the benefits of an oil price recovery to come straight through to 1987 profits without being cut back by other sectors.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Spedding noted that it needed about 12 dlrs a barrel to make money, and at about 15 dlrs a barrel revenue from production and its downstream activities would push it comfortably into surplus.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The remainder would come from new borrowings, partly from banks under a four-year committed revolving credit facility and partly from a a new U.
